medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsened abdominal pain associated with jaundice and weight loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient originally presented with epigastric pain and jaundice, with symptoms worsening over time. The abdominal pain was described as 'very bad' for the past 3 days and 'unbearable' starting last night. He reports that the pain gradually worsened and was initially dull and achy, radiating to the back. The pain worsens with road bumps and after meals. He has also reported unchanged loose stools for years and a weight loss of 35 pounds over the past three months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic abdominal pain, chronic diarrhea, hypertension, congenital hiatal hernia, chronic arthralgias and myalgias.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with hyperlipidemia and COPD; father with cancer and coronary artery disease; paternal uncle with cancer; maternal grandmother with cancer; maternal cousin with cancer. No family history of neuroendocrine tumors.
medical_history.social_history: Occasional alcohol intake with friends, specifically mentioning a beer and whiskey; otherwise not specified.
